111212.content:
The car ride was surprisingly easy going and went by quickly, even though catgirl lived about 30 minutes out of town. I tried not to pry and to let her offer up information on her own, but I was consumed with curiosity. She was the most fascinating girl I'd ever met.
         "My name is Analisse," she blurted when we finally parked.
         "It's been nice meeting you, Analisse. I'm Chase." I couldn't help but smile at her. She smiled back, her cheeks turning red, and looked away quickly.
         "I.. have to go," she grabbed the bag of groceries from the car floorboard and reached for the handle.
         "Wait!"
         Analisse paused, her hand resting on the door handle.
         "I want to see you again. Will you go out with me Friday night?" I proposed.
         She was silent for a moment, her hand still lay resting on the handle.
         "I will," she finally replied, "be here at eight." She picked her things up and jumped out of the vehicle, somehow gracefully.
         I watched her walk up the pathway to her front door and waited until she was safely inside before driving away. Although, our time knowing each other had been short, my mind was already engulfed in thoughts of her. As I drove away I began thinking of what we could do on Friday. It was only three days away and I had to make this outing perfect; I had to know more about her, but where would I take her?

1142221.content: You are going to a circus that you heard was good, when you notice the freakshow tent. You show the man your ticket, and he lets you in, but he grabs your shoulder and says "...The things in there are not happy. Help them if you can." You enter the tent. 114222121.content:
You make your way over to the "furry" cage, curious as to what sort of animal a circus would put in its "freak-show" tent. You made your way through the small crowd gathered around the cage, working your way to the front.

As you approach the cage, you can see its contents: A slightly-pudgy orange vixen. She's about five feet tall, with a white throat, underbelly, and inner thighs. And true to the doorman's word, she did not look happy. It seemed she was trying her hardest to pretend she was somewhere else, lying on the dirty floor with her back to all of the people, even as they called to her. Once in a while, she'd tuck her legs into her chest, whimper softly, or roll onto her back.

The only times she'd engage the "audience" is when she smelled food. Even though people weren't allowed to bring food into the tent, they did anyway. Either the doorman simply didn't notice, or didn't care. One such man in a blue shirt smuggled in a corn-dog, which the vixen took notice of, sniffing the air pensively and turning toward him.

"C-corn-dog..?" she squeaked. The man simply raised an eyebrow at her as he raised the carnival cuisine in question to his lips.

"Yes?" he answered. "What about it?"

"Can I... Have it? I'm hungry..."

"You look like they feed you enough already." You glance over at the corner of the cage at what appears to be a food-bowl; it's empty, and has been so for who knows how long. You also note a few bits of debris left over from other bits of food she's managed to get others to part with.

"But... I'm hungry..."

"I paid five dollars for this corn-dog. I'm not giving it to you."

"Pleeeeeeeeeeeease?" she whimpered, dropping to her knees and groveling. "I'm starving..."

The man began waving the corn-dog in front of her. "You want this?"

She reached outside the bars of her cage, pawing at it. A din rose among the crowd, and she shrank back. "Y-yes..."

"What are you going to do for it?"

"What... What do you want me to do?" She absolutely didn't like where this was going, and neither did you.

"Down. Get down on all fours..."

"Oh... Okay." She wasn't particularly thrilled with the request, but you were slightly relieved by the lack of molestation. She did as she was told, dropping to her hand-paws and staring up at the man.

"Lower." The vixen obeyed, her chest hovering closer to the cage's floor. "Lower, I said. I want you kissing that floor, Tubs." Her muzzle made contact with metal just a moment later.

"Yes, sir..." came her slightly-muffled voice.

"Pfffft. Pathetic. Here's your damn food, you animal." He punctuated his last remark by throwing the corn-battered hot-dog at her exposed back, smearing mustard as it rolled downwards. The crowd laughed at this display. You didn't.

"Th-thank you..." Her eyes watered a bit as she reached for her reward and immediately began devouring it. The crowd cheered as she finished. She winced at the outburst, but finished the last bits of meat in a few seconds, only to begin chewing on the empty stick and wipe the mustard off of her back.

It was a sorry sight, indeed, and you didn't really want to see any more. You couldn't really leave her, though...
114222121.title: A Caged Animal

choices: Go see the doorman about the vixen.
Sneak about the circus, looking for either someone or something to free her.
1142221211.content:
You wait for the crowd to disperse. You don't have to wait long, though, as they all begin to wander over to the other cage, where its resident seems a bit more active. With nobody watching the fox, you decide to approach her.

She's already gone back to ignoring all of the people in the tent, but you try to strike up a conversation anyway.

"Hello," you start.

You get no answer from the vixen.

"Hello?" You try again. No answer. She's either willfully ignoring you or she's in her own little world. "Hmmm."

You know what will get her to talk, though. You leave the tent, and return with five funnel-cakes; probably a lot more than you needed to get her to talk, but there probably wasn't any harm in overfeeding her. You and the doorman exchange glances as you re-enter, but he doesn't say anything. The fox is still alone, and still lying quietly. As you approach, she begins sniffing the air as she rolls over. You've certainly got her attention, now.

"Funnel-cakes?" she says.

You nod.

"That's a lot of funnel-cakes..." She's visibly salivating, which you find sort of cute.

You nod again, chuckling. "It is. Five of 'em. Do you want some?"

"Yes!" That was the most excited you'd seen her all day, but she quickly returned to her sullen demeanor. "What do I have to do..?"

"Nothing. Here you go." You slip a piece of fried dough halfway through the iron bars, and she greedily pulls it through the rest of the way. She giggles as she raises it to her mouth and takes a big bite, chewing loudly. She finishes it in twenty seconds flat, and belches shortly after.

She turns to you again and cocks her head. You smile and slip her another. "Thankyouthankyouthankyouthankyou..." She tears into the next one with equal gusto, and you slip another one through the bars for when she's finished. She snatches it from your hand before she's done with her current one, holding it aloft in her paw as she pops the last bit of her second cake into her muzzle.

"You like funnel-cakes?" She nods vigorously as she chews through her third. You can see why she's so chubby.

"Yeah!" she says between bites. "Love 'em. Although, I guess I like just about anything..."

"Well, I'm glad you like them." You nibble on one of the remaining cakes as she finishes hers. "What's your name?" you ask.

"Name..? I..." She stops eating to think, but just shakes her head in frustration. "I don't know..."

"You... You don't know?"

"No..." she sighs. She begins playing with a tag on the collar you didn't realize she was wearing. You take a closer look at the tag, only seeing the letter "T" emblazoned on it. You wonder what it means, but quickly realize that it stands for the owner of the circus: Thomas Timmens. "I guess you can call me 'Tea.'"

"Sure, 'Tea.' Where did you come from?"

"The forest..." An annoyingly-vague answer, but if she doesn't know her own name, you doubt she'd be able to name the forest she came from. "I used to live in a little den in the woods. Now I don't..." You can see she doesn't like talking about this, as she begins to sniffle. You slip her the last uneaten funnel-cake to cheer her up.

"I'm sorry to hear that..." You carry on with small-talk, as you tell her about yourself, where you live, what you do... Her end of the conversation only seems to consist of acknowledgments of your statements mixed in with a summary of all of the foods she's eaten here at the circus. Not the most riveting conversationalist, but you're happy that she seems happy. You slip her the remains of the funnel-cake you'd been eating, which she's just as excited to accept, and turn around.

"Where are you going?" she asks through a mouthful of fried dough.

"It's been nice talking to you, but I've gotta go."

"Oh..." she sighs. "Well, it's been nice talking to you, too." She looks down at the last of her funnel-cake, but instead of eating it, she tosses it in her bowl. As you walk away, she cries out, "Come back and see me, okay?"

Yes, you have business to attend to...
1142221211.title: A Caged Conversation

choices: Alright, time for a daring rescue.
Perhaps this isn't the best way to go about this?
11422212111.content:
You figure that the best thing to do was to follow-up with the doorman who told you to "help" the caged anthros. As you exit the tent with a crowd of people, you nod to him.

"I see she liked the funnel-cakes," he says flatly.

"She did," you returned. "What can you tell me about her?"

"Nothing she's not already told you, unfortunately. I'm not privy to the dealings of the circus at large; I just stand here taking tickets..."

"You know nothing?"

"Nothing. All I know is that fox is miserable, and it breaks my heart seeing her like that."

"Why do you let it happen? Just let her rot in there, letting them do whatever they do to her?"

The man sighs bitterly. "What do you want me to do? All I've got is this job. As much as I'd love to swoop in and save her... I can't. All I can do is slip her a bit of food she doesn't have to beg for."

"And if you can't do anything, what am I supposed to do?"

"I... You... Save her. That's what you do. I told you to help her, and that's what you'll do!"

"How?" you hiss. "How do I do that? Who do I talk to, where do I go? What do I do?"

The doorman seems to be just as frustrated as you are, but you can see a spark of inspiration on his face as he calms down.

"I don't know, sir, but you'll have to excuse me... I need to go on patrol. This attraction is closing." The man steps forward and fiddles with something in his pockets.

"Okay?"

"Oh, dear. Where have I put my keys? I can't seem to find them..." he says hollowly as he looks at you and glances over at a spot on the ground. You see the keys in question, and he winks at you.

You nod back at him as you pick up the keys. "Alright, I see your game..."

"What game, sir? There's no game..." His eyes shift about, making sure nobody sees the two of you, and whispers, "Make sure you free both of them."

"Will do."
11422212111.title: Seeing a Man About a Fox

114222121111.content:
You enter the now-empty tent and make your way over to reptile cage. The creature inside ignores you until you place a key in the lock and open the cage door.

"Thanks," she says flatly. She sprints out of the cage, out of the tent and out of earshot.

"You're... You're welcome." With that out of the way, you head over to the vixen, the one you were really here for. She's still lying on the floor of her cage, only she's whimpering, this time. She doesn't seem to hear you, and only moves when she hears the key turning in the lock.

"Nooooooo..." she moans. "Please, don't hurt me..."

"Don't what?"

With a jolt, she turns around.

"You!"

"Yes, 'Me.' Who were you expecting?"

"The ringleader, coming to beat me for taking food from customers..."

"Oh. I, uh... Well."

She sighs. "But you came! You came back!" She springs to her feet to embrace you, nuzzling your neck.

"Yes, I did. We're leaving."

"'We?' You mean..?"

"Yes. You're not going to be in that awful cage anymore. You're coming with me."

She squeals, the happiest she's been in a long time, but her ears lower as she wonders aloud: "But... What'll they do to me if they catch us? They'll killme..." She drops to the ground, in the fetal position.

"They won't. At least, they won't if we hurry. Come on"

"But... I'm scared."

At this point, you simply scoop the fox up in your arms. She's a bit heavy, no doubt, but not that bad. "Let's go."

She throws her arms around your neck, holding on for dear life as you sprint out of the tent with your new friend...
114222121111.title: Fox's Freedom

1142221211112.content:
You and Tea miraculously manage to avoid being caught by any of the circus staff on the way from the tent to the parking lot. The sun's been going down for the past hour, now, and everyone's either gone home or headed to the main tent to see the big show; this break-out couldn't have been better timed, and you probably don't need to be running so fast. On the other hand, there certainly wouldn't be much point in dawdling...

Your car's on the other side of the lot from the entrance; you couldn't find better parking, earlier. You're just thankful that you remember where it is and nobody's around to see you carrying away circus property. You make your way to your beat-up blue car and open one of the back-doors, ushering the nervous vixen inside. You instruct her to lie on the seats so that nobody sees her as you drive home. She quietly obeys, and you strap her in with the seat-belts as best you can. The pudgy orange fox is visibly uncomfortable, squirming against her new confines, but there's nothing you can do about it beside pat her head and lightly console her.

"I... I don't like this..." she whines.

"I'm sorry, girl, but there's not a lot I can do about that..." you reply.

You hop in the driver's seat, and put the key in the ignition. She whines even louder as the car comes to life, but you hush her as you drive off.

You try to keep her calm with idle conversation, but you don't seem to find much to talk about, having already exhausted such fodder during your first meeting.

You settle on discussing her future, hoping she sees it as brightly as you do.

"So... You're out of there, now," you say.

"Y-yeah..." she says half-heartedly. You're not sure if she's simply nervous from the car-ride or if she's actually regretting leaving.

"Where do you think we're going?"

"I-I-I don't know..." She's... Afraid?

"What's the matter?"

"N-nothing."

"We're just going home."

"Home?"

"Yeah, home. My house."

"Right..."

You both remain silent for a few minutes. You look into the back-seat every once in a while at your passenger. She's trembling slightly and closing her eyes. You sigh as you bring your attention back to the road. Not that there's anything all that interesting aside from a few billboards and some bushes on the side of the road.

"Do you think I'm going to hurt you?" you ask, frankly.

"I... No, I don't..."

"C'mon, now... All I wanted to do was get you out of that cage. You're safe now, safe from them."

"... Yeah."

"That part of your life is over and done, with a new chapter just beginning."

"Yeah..."

"Now, I'm not sure where you want that to go..." You glance to the back-seat, and manage to lock eyes with the vixen for just a moment.

"I don't know..." She looks away.

"Alright. In the meantime, you'll stay with me until you figure out where you wanna go. You'll be safe, have somewhere warm to sleep, and plenty to eat."

"Eat?" She sounded excited at that part, which made you chuckle.

"Yeah, plenty. We just gotta get home... We're almost there."

You've just come upon the city limits, and you're well on your way to your street. A few blocks later, and you're in front of your house, pulling into the driveway. It's not a very stately house: The unadorned siding is a stark white, and within its cramped walls were only a few rooms containing the necessities of life. It's rather impressive for a young man such as yourself to have a house, regardless of its size... And remarkably convenient for smuggling a stolen fox, especially when you don't have any roommates.

"Here we are: Home, sweet home," you say as you open the car-door in the back to let Tea out. As you undo her buckles, she practically leaps from the seats and onto the path. To your relief, that's as far as she goes; she's not going to run, and she seems to trust you enough.

"Home..." she sighs.

"Home." You nod at her as you take her arm and begin stepping up the walk. She follows you, staring ahead. You hope she'll warm to the idea of living with you, just as much as you hope you'll be able to get used to having a very dependent roommate. Whether or not the two of you do, though, it's just the way it's going to have to be. Whether she sees herself as your roommate, your pet, or your captive... She's a "fugitive," and somebody's going to come looking for her once they realize she's gone. They'll take her back to the circus, or worse, and she certainly wouldn't like that.

You've only got a few yards to your front door, but no bushes or shrubs to hide the two of you. Hopefully nobody sees you...
1142221211112.title: Homeward

11422212111122.content:
You've reached your doorstep without any incident. You look over your shoulder at the street to make extra-sure that nobody's watching, and unlock your door. The pudgy vixen is ushered inside first, and you follow, closing the door behind you. Tea takes a moment to survey her new living space while you close some blinds.

The front door opens into your rather spartan living room, housing an ugly old sofa and a small television with assorted electronics surrounding it. Besides these two most essential elements, there's a couple of posters on the walls... And a lamp in the corner, next to a window. The floor is covered in light-gray carpeting.

The kitchen is conjoined to the living room to the right of the door, cutting off the carpet and giving way to plain linoleum tile. It's got just about everything a kitchen should have, including a stove and refrigerator, with a counter between the two. Atop the counter sit a microwave and a toaster, and above those are some cupboards. At the far end of the kitchen, next to the refrigerator, is a closed door; this is the pantry. Opposite the wall from the counter is a small dining table, with two plastic chairs at opposite ends.

Between the living room and the kitchen is the hallway, into which the living room's carpet continues. There are five doors along the walls: Two each on the left and right walls, with a single door at the back. The back door is simply a coat closet; not much to note there. The door on the right closest to it leads to the bathroom, with the door closest the kitchen leading to the laundry room. The door on the left closest the coat closet leads into your bedroom. The last door leads to a spare room which you've not figured out what to do with. All walls in the house are painted a stark white.

Tea looks somewhat impressed by her new digs; being that she used to live in a small metal cage, however, it probably doesn't take much to impress her.

"Wow..." she says.

"I, um... Yeah, this is my house..." you say, embarrassed. "So... First thing's first..."

"Hmm?"

"Before we get you settled in... Perhaps you'd like to--"

"Eat?"

"In a bit, but... Maybe you'd like to take a shower?" You didn't want to say anything, but the fox smelled a bit gamey. You're not a snob when it comes to cleanliness, but given the way she'd been living, it might be nice if she was bathed.

"Shower..?"

"Ah... Follow me." Oh, dear. It looks like you'll have to explain to her how she bathes. You lead her to your bathroom and open the door, revealing teal walls and blue tile. A toilet sat closest to the door, with a white sink in a bathroom counter right next to it. At the back of the room was a combination bath/shower, with some blue polka-dot curtains allowing for privacy. "See, I need you to step into the bathtub, there..." She obeyed, padding across the bathroom floor and into your cream-colored bathtub.

"And..?"

"Well, see, there's a knob there, on the wall. Just turn it, and water will come out of that shower-head... You get all wet, and then you rub that bar of soap all over your body... And then let the water rinse it off, rubbing yourself."

"Oh! Yeah, I know..."

"Did they never bathe you at the circus?"

The vixen blushed at the question. "They just sprayed me with a hose and threw soapy water on me..."

"Well, um... We don't do that, here. If you know what to do, I'll be in the kitchen. There's a towel on the rack right there; just holler if you need anything..."

"O-okay..."

A few moments later, you were in the kitchen, putting some water on the stove to boil. You figured that tonight would be a good night for some store-brand macaroni-and-cheese. After you got a blue box down from the cupboard, you went to check on Tea, who was just wandering out of the bathroom draped in a green towel, sopping wet.

"I'm done..." the fox said, shivering. "It's so cold..."

"Oh, um... Just step back into the bathroom; you're dripping all over the carpet."

"I'm sorry..."

"No, it's okay. Let me help you get dry..." You head into the bathroom to fetch the hair-dryer from one of the drawers in the counter and plug it in. The noise scares the pudgy vixen as it roars to life, but she seems to like the feel of hot air blowing against her fur, softly moaning as it makes its way down her body. As you finish, you instruct her to wrap the towel around her waist, above her tail, and lead her to the kitchen. "Just sit down, and I'll finish making dinner."

"Okay." Tea smiled at the thought of food.

Ten minutes, a couple pats of butter, and quarter-cup of milk later, dinner was ready. You take a couple bowls down from the cupboard and pour half of the pot into one of them. You set the full bowl in front of the vixen, and before you have a chance to get her a spoon, she's already dove into muzzle-first, eating it like a... Well, an animal. You watch with mild amusement as she slurps up the steaming hot yellow glop, finishing the bowl in only a couple minutes.

"I was going to get you a spoon..." you say, flatly.

The fox doesn't say anything, simply looking down at her empty bowl in what appeared to be shame. "Oh."

"It's alright, it's alright..." You start dishing yourself the rest of the macaroni and take a seat opposite the orange vixen. "Did you like it?"

"Y-yeah... Thank you."

"You're welcome," you respond, through a mouthful of pasta.

The two of you sit in silence for a bit; you're eating your meal, and Tea is intently watching you do so while licking her chops to get whatever residual cheese sauce is staining them. You manage to finish half of your bowl before a loud gurgling emanates from your dining companion across the table.

"It's... It's just my stomach..." she says, embarrassed.

You roll your eyes and sigh, silently pushing the rest of your macaroni toward her, which she happily accepts. This time, she makes a point of using the spoon, shoveling in pasta as quickly as it allows her. Once more, she's through her food in only a couple of minutes.

"Thank you..."

"Don't mention it," you say as you get up to load all of the dirty dishes into the dishwasher. "Let's just head over to the couch."

The fox silently follows you over to the sofa, leaving her wet towel behind on the seat. You motion for her to sit down, and she falls back into the ragged piece of seating, with you following suit. You don't really have a lot to talk about, so you'll let the television distract the two of you, turning on the set and switching over to some sitcom. You'd zone out, but you're having more fun watching Tea, who is transfixed on the screen, as if she's studying some piece of forgotten lore.

As two characters on-screen get a bit romantic, she begins looking a bit uncomfortable. The female of the two characters slowly lowers her head into the male's lap; the vixen surprises you by following suit. You chuckle, which seems to shock her upright.

"Oh! I'm... I'm sorry," she says, flustered. "I'm just--"

"No, it's alright. Shhh. Lie down," you say, gesturing to your lap. She gingerly lowers herself back onto your lap, now looking quite uncomfortable. "Are you okay?"

"Yeah, I'm... I'm fine..."

You start stroking her neck, which makes her tense up at first, but she seems to relax a second or two later, so you keep going. Her eyes start to flutter shut, so you turn off the TV.

"Thank you for saving me..." she whispers.

"You're welcome, sweetheart..." you coo back. "You think you're gonna like it here?.. For now?"

"Yeah..."

"Gettin' sleepy?"

"Yeah..."
11422212111122.title: Settling In

choices: You awake to the sound of your alarm clock; it was a very restful night.
Tea frantically wakes you up; what's wrong?
114222121111221.content:
Tea yawns, and you do too. The sun's been down for hours, and with the television off, you don't see much reason to remain conscious.

"We should probably go to bed..." you say, lazily.

The pudgy vixen nods slowly, barely moving in your lap. You're not entirely sure what you're going to do about sleeping arrangements...

But you figure the fox won't mind sleeping on the couch, if only just for tonight. You slip out from under Tea as gently as you can and go to fetch some spare bedding from the hall closet. You return to the living room to find a somewhat-more-alert Tea waiting for you, peering over the back of the couch.

"What do you have there?" she asks sleepily.

"Just a blanket and a couple of pillows, girl. Here, feel them," you say as you hand her a plain white pillow in a plain white pillowcase. She squeezes it in her arms and nuzzles it, reveling in its softness (at least, softness compared to a metal surface), and you surprise her by draping a blue blanket over her. She's momentarily startled, squeaking a bit, but moans as she begins feeling the warmth of her cover.

"Ooooh, I like these..."

"That's good to hear." You place the other pillow on the couch behind her, and head off down the hallway to get ready for bed, yourself. "Goodnight, Tea," you whisper as you turn out the lights in the living room. She whines for a moment, but you're sure she'll be fine...

---------------------------------------------------


A half-an-hour later, you've completed all of your night-time rituals. Your teeth are cared for, your body clean... And you've changed into something a bit more comfortable: A pair of pajama bottoms but no shirt. There's nothing left to do but crawl into bed. You open your bedroom door and step inside. Like the rest of your house, it's rather small, and not particularly impressive.

There's a queen-sized bed in the corner, just a couple feet from the door. The bed itself isn't particularly elaborate; it's barely more than a mattress with legs. A royal blue comforter is spread across it, with slightly-lighter blue bedsheets underneath. You've got a couple of pillows at the head of the bed, both the same color as the ones you gave to the fox in the living room. A nightstand sits beside the bed, holding a lamp and a digital clock. On the opposite wall from the bed is a modest desk setup that houses your computer and a cup full of pens. The "fanciest" piece of furniture you own sits beside the desk: A wardrobe, housing what little clothing you choose to own. The same carpet that runs throughout your living room and hallway is laid on the floor in here. The only thing you've got on your walls is a poster next to the door; a lack of windows in this room makes the walls look especially bare.

Still, it's home.

You practically fling yourself onto your bed; it's been a full day, and you're more than ready to end it. All is dark, your bed is soft and warm, and you're drifting off to sleep... Until you hear some scratching at your door. In your half-awake state, you're not entirely sure what that would be. Something starts jostling the doorknob, and you get a little worried. You turn on the lamp just in time for the door to fly open, revealing a thick, dark figure standing in the doorway. You shout, and it squeaks back, trembling.

... It's just Tea, clutching a pillow. You sigh.

"I... I..." she stutters. "I'm--"

"What?" you say, more brusquely than you would otherwise.

"I'm... I'm sorry! I'm scared..."

"Of..? Of what?"

"It's dark! I don't like the dark..."

"Well, what did you do at the circus? I imagine you must have coped somehow..."

"I... I didn't!" In the lamp-light, you can see tears forming in the fox's golden eyes.

You sigh. "So... What do we do about it?"

She hesitates for a moment before answering. "... Can I sleep in here? Please? I feel safe with you!"

Not entirely sure how to react to that, you acquiesce. "Sure, just... Wait here. I'll get the rest of your bedding."

"Okay..."

You wander out to the living room and groggily snatch up her pillow and blanket from the couch, and return to your room to find the pudgy orange vixen curled up on the floor, trembling.

"No, no... Get up. I'm not making you sleep on the floor..."

"I'm... I'm really sorry..."

"It's fine, it's fine... Just... Get in bed." The fox does as she's told, and you toss her bedding to her. She promptly tucks a pillow behind her back and head, and places one between her thighs.

"Are you mad?" she asks.

"No, I'm just tired..." You climb into bed beside her, trying to get yourself comfortable again. You're used to having this bed all to yourself...

"Do you regret it?"

"Regret what?"

"Saving me..." She sniffles, and you sigh. You stroke her neck reassuringly.

"No, sweetheart... Of course I don't..."

"I'm sorry..." Tea places an arm over your bare chest and leans in closer to you.

"Don't be."

The vixen pecks you on the cheek; a tiny, tender kiss.

"G-goodnight..." You scoot a bit closer to Tea and embrace her. She gasps, but doesn't resist. In fact, she responds by leaning into you and putting her muzzle on your neck.

"Goodnight, Tea."

You weren't sure about letting her sleep in your bed with you, but... This isn't so bad. She's like a big, warm body pillow mixed with a plush toy. Her overall thickness made her quite soft, and the sound of her breathing soothed you. You pull the covers over the two of you, and you both drift off to sleep, the grateful vixen lying peacefully in your arms.
114222121111221.title: Bedtime

choices: Gotta get ready for work...  You'll have to figure out what to do with Tea.
Wait, you've got the day off!
1142221211112211.content:
Your eyes flutter open to a dark room; the only thing you can make out in the dark are the stark red numbers on your digital alarm clock.

Speaking of: It's blaring some obnoxious talk-radio show; that'd be your alarm. It seems you've woken up just in time. On near-instinct, your arm shoots over to the "shut up" button on top of it, and you're rewarded with silence.

Well, near-silence... A light breathing in your ear reminds you that you shared a bed with a plump vixen last night. Tea's muzzle parts just an inch to release a tiny yawn, but she's still sound asleep.

You're quite awake, though; no more sleep for you. You turn on your lamp and roll out of bed, careful not to disturb the fox. Before you start your day, though, you contemplate waking Tea up. She's so cute; you'd hate to wake her. But... You get the feeling she's just going to start panicking if she wakes up by herself and there's nobody there with her.

You decide to err on the side of caution, and just wake her up now. You put your hand on her orange-furred shoulder and rouse her as gently as you can manage. Despite that, though, she dramatically awakens with a gasp, her eyes shooting open and darting about the room.

"Where am I?!" she cries. Well, it looks like she was just going to panic, anyway; maybe you should have let her sleep...

"Tea..." you start.

"Where am I? Wh-"

"Tea. Calm down... You're in my bed. Remember..?"

"I- Um. Y-yeah..." She blushes deeply through her white cheek-fur as she remembers the events of yesterday and realizes she was beginning to spaz out. "... Sorry."

"It's alright, girl. You're safe, nobody's going to hurt you."

"Y-yeah..." She absent-mindedly clutches the tag of the collar that she's been wearing this entire time.

"You want me to get rid of that?"

"O-okay..."

You slowly reach toward her neck, careful not to startle her, as you finger the collar's clasp at the back of her neck. With a bit of fiddling, the clasp pops loose, and the collar falls to the bed.

"Better? You're not a part of that circus, anymore. You don't have to wear that collar."

"Yeah... Th-thank you..." She begins feeling her bare neck, spending quite a bit of time tracing the matted fur once covered by nylon.

"I'll go ahead and destroy this, later. Right now, though, I'll just put it in my wardrobe."

"O-okay..."

"Now, just wait right here. I'm going to go get freshened up for the day..."

You stroll out of your room, careful to leave the door open, and head into the bathroom...

-------------------------------------------------------


You return to the room about twenty minutes later with a towel wrapped around your waist. Tea's still in your bed, just like you told her to be, curled up around a pillow as she nervously looks around your room

"Tea, are you alright?.." you ask.

"Huh..? Oh, you're back!"

"Well, I don't think I ever left, but... Yeah, I'm back."

"What do we do now..?"

As you walk over to your wardrobe to get dressed, you think a moment... What are you doing?
1142221211112211.title: Good Morning!

choices: Tea's still on the couch, engrossed by the television.
Oh, dear.  Tea's nowhere to be seen.
11422212111122111.content:
You sigh as you reach for your light blue button-up work shirt.

"Well... I have to go to work," you say. "I'll be leaving in an hour or so, and I'll be gone for a while after that."

"G-gone..? But... That means I'll be alone," she whines.

You turn around to face her. She's sitting upright in your bed, intently looking at you. Her eyes are beginning to tear a bit, and you can't help but feel guilty. However...

"I'm afraid there's nothing I can do about that. I've gotta go to work, and I can't take you with me."

"Right..."

"You'll be fine, girl. Here, let's go get you something to eat." Tea becomes noticeably perkier at the mention of food, and you smile. You quickly pull your shirt on, followed by a pair of socks and some slacks, and begin heading out the bedroom door, motioning for the plump vixen to follow. Like an excitable puppy, she practically leaps from the bed to your side, and you both proceed to the kitchen.

You wonder what you'd fix for the two of you this morning. It'd be nice to welcome the fox to her new home with a stack of pancakes and some fried eggs and bacon, but... That takes effort, and you're pretty sure she'd be just as impressed with a bowl of cereal. That's your general breakfast fare, anyway. You fetch a couple of ceramic bowls from the cupboard, and place them at the table, where Tea has already seated herself. A couple of spoons soon sit in each bowl, and next comes a heaping serving of off-brand Corn Flakes. You head for the refrigerator to get the milk, but a loud crunching behind you tells you that Tea's already started shoveling dry cereal into her muzzle. You fetch the milk and bring it to the table, watching Tea struggle to chew the tough flakes.

"Tea, you gotta eat them with milk..." The vixen finishes chewing and swallows hard, turning to look at you in confusion as you pour milk on her corn flakes. "Just let that sit for a moment, and it'll soften them."

"Oh..."

You laugh as you begin pouring milk on your own corn flakes, taking a seat opposite the fox.

"So... Sleep well?" you ask.

"Y-yeah..." the vixen answers, eyeing her breakfast. "When can I..?"

"Just a few more seconds..." An awkward silence follows, punctuated by a gurgle from Tea's empty stomach. "Okay. Now you can eat them."

The vixen wastes no time diving into the cereal, taking heaping spoonful after heaping spoonful to her eager muzzle. She looks like she's barely chewing between each bite, and it worries you a bit... But before you can say anything, she's finished her bowl, looking at you and pleading with her eyes for more.

"Okay, okay... But try to go a bit slower this time, alright? You're gonna choke if you keep eating like that." You pour her another bowl, and sit back down.

"Thank you..." She only takes marginally longer to finish her second bowl, but luckily, she doesn't ask for more, instead content to drink the leftover milk in the bowl. You finish your own cereal, and take the empty bowls to the sink, rinse them out, and leave them for a proper washing later.

"Now... I've gotta get going, soon..." you say. "Are you going to be okay all alone?"

"No..."

"Sure you will. You've just gotta keep yourself occupied. Maybe watch some television?"

"O-okay..."

You lead her over to the couch and lay her down, turning on the television and hand her the remote, showing her what few buttons she'd need to operate it. She half-heartedly nods at each instruction, and as you head out the front door, Tea still looks incredibly apprehensive, watching you as much as she's watching the television set. You close the door and hope for the best as you head to your car.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------< br />
You return home several hours later after a full day at work, exhausted. As you plod up the walkway from your car, you think of Tea. Hopefully, she fared okay. You'll see in a moment when you get inside...
11422212111122111.title: The Day Ahead

114222121111221111.content:
She's in the exact same spot she was in when you left. By the looks of it, it doesn't look like she even knows you arrived. You slowly creep up behind her and wrap your arms around her.

"I'm home! Did you miss me?" You ask in a playful tone.To your surprise, Tea wasn't startled or surprised in any way.
"You're back! You were gone forever! I thought you were never coming back but you're back! I'm so happy!" Replied Tea, as her tail swayed rapidly. She then proceeded to lick your face wildly, causing you to blush. After a few seconds Tea realized what she was doing and stopped, blushing as well.

"S-Sorry. I didn't mean to lick you." Tea looked away in an attempt to hide her blush." Soooo. How was work?"
"It was fine. Just a regular day at the office." At this point you start to head towards your room to change into clothes that felt more comfortable. When you returned to Tea, you sit next to her on the couch as you surf through some channels to find something that interests both of you. You eventually settle on a romantic film. Throughout the film, the main lovers were shown hiding each other's feelings for one another until the end when they admit their feelings and live happily ever after.

"Well the movie's over. What do you want for dinner Tea!" Tea immediately perked her head in your direction.
"Food! What are we gonna eat! I can't wait to eat! I haven't eaten anything since you left earlier today! I'll eat just about anything right now!"
'I think you'd eat anything anytime' you thought in your head. You were so tired from working today that you didn't want to make anything.
"Hey Tea, think you're in the mood for some pizza?" Tea proceeded to run up to you and hugged you.
"I want pizza please!" You call the local pizzeria and ordered two large meat lovers pizza. After hanging up you went back to the couch with Tea.

"Now Tea. When the pizza arrives go into the kitchen. We can't let anyone see you. Got it?" Tea nods as you both turn your attention to the television. Tea moves closer to you and you wrap your arm around her. For some reason being with Tea made you happier than normal. You shrugged the thought and decided to deal it later. Soon after there's a knock at the door. Tea proceeds to hide in the kitchen while you go to pay for the pizza. Afterwards Tea comes out and starts devouring the pizza without hesitation.

'She's got to go easy on all the food. I'm pretty sure all this eating is going to catch up with her someday. Oh well, if she's happy then I guess it's alright.' You then proceed to grab a slice yourself and eat.

A couple minutes pass and all of the pizza is gone. Granted Tea ate nearly everything. As she finishes the final slice, she pats her bloated stomach in satisfaction. A soft moan then escapes her muzzle.
"Looks like someone had fun."
"I sure did. I've never eaten that much pizza in one sitting. It was delicious. I am starting to get tired though."
"Why don't you start heading towards the bedroom and I'll be there in a bit." Tea nods and makes her way towards the bedroom as you proceed to take a shower. Afterwards you put on your regular sleep attire and hop into bed. Tea then leans closer towards you as you do the same.

"Thank you for all you've been doing for me. I really appreciate it." Tea then plants a gentle kiss onto your lips.
"I love you."
I love you too Tea."

114222121111221112.content:
You open the door and head inside.

"Okay, Tea. I'm home," you say as you close the door behind you. She doesn't respond, though. "... Tea?" Heading over to the television, you note it's still on, but there's a distinct lack of fox on the sofa. You look about the kitchen and living room, hoping you'd simply missed her, but... Nope.

She's not where you left her.

You panic for a moment, but rein it in; you still have the rest of the house to check. Surely, she's somewhere here. She wouldn't be bold enough to leave the house, would she?

You make your way to the bedroom, and peer inside. "Tea?" you whisper. Scanning the room, there's no sign of her. She's not in the bed, nowhere near the desk, not hiding in the corners...

You try the bathroom, next. Maybe she's in there? You open the door, take a look... Nope.

Next door would be the laundry room. She wouldn't have much business in there, but maybe she was exploring... You peek inside. There's a washer, a dryer, a water heater, all on the same wall. Same linoleum floor as the kitchen, wooden cupboards above the washer and and dryer, and a door at the other end. You note that it isn't locked...

She wouldn't be bold enough to leave the house, would she?

But, there's one more room to check before you jump to that nightmare scenario: The spare room. You notice that the door behind you is slightly ajar, and you don't remember having opened it...
114222121111221112.title: A Missing Vixen

1142221211112211121.content:
You slowly push the door all the way open, and peer inside. The spare room's a jumbled mess of... Well, all sorts of stuff.

This has been the room that's collected all of the junk you never found a place for in the rest of the house. Niche kitchen appliances you received as housewarming presents that you couldn't fit in the kitchen? They're in here, right beneath the window. Therefore, I wear the skin and furry pelt of a Pronghorn deer. It was until tonight as my secret, and yours as well, I hope!" Deb said, as she explained why she left her working for the Doctor, and his lucrative paying employment.
12322.title: Suddenly, Deb awoke...

123221.content:
I sat there on the side of her bed, just looking at her face. I had placated her to explain the how and the why she was as a furry person, but that left me wondering if she and I could be more than just friends.

"What," Debra said, she looking up at me, and my face having no special expression as to what I might be thinking.

"You know, I have loved you since the first time we met, and wanted to be closer to you for a long while. As now this revelation, to me it does not matter, as I am in love with the person I met, knew, and felt a sense of love. You ask as of me to keep your secret, as much why should I want to humiliate the person for who I feel love.

If by our mutual feelings, one for the other, that I am a help to you with coping, keeping our secret as private, gives me even more reasons to love you, as I want you to love me. Oh, and know this, that when I say love my meaning is not just that of a sexual attraction. If you would as well love me, my hope is to make our relationship as of a permanent, a lifetime form of companionship." I told Deb, as she listened, but did not show the sense of glee what I expected or hoped she might feel.

"What you do not know of yet, is that I must return once each year to pay a visit to Professor Beaker, and have him inject me with the anti-cell inhibitor, what works as to nullify the otherwise continuing effects of what Greta infected into me. As part of life, the Professor is getting old and in due time will retire from the research laboratory. When that happens, my supply of inhibitor will dry up, and the infection I hold within me shall grow, as go rampant, causing me to change, and become then as a Pronghorn doe deer.

I know that time will come, as I could make it happen sooner, if just by not going to get my injection.

Odd and crazy as it mat sound to you, but something in me, as more than a wish or thought, but there lurks an urge. I hold an urge to want for becoming as is a deer. I know that if Greta had not done to me what she did and infecting me, I would never have wished, wanted to become as is an animal.

We as humans have many forms of illnesses, and by being changed into an animal, the amount of illness or injuries increases dramatically. Animals have no idea about personal hygiene, they feel jealousy and bite hunks out of a near companion. They fight, kick, butt heads, and try in any way how to deter a foe.

Know this, I am not a virgin. although I did not give up being a virgin of my own will, but from Doctor Haun's son I lost my hymen. To know the Doctor is to know a man with an ego driven by the pride of his discoveries. His children have a sense of social specialty, they are rich and spoiled. Terrance and Tina are both human, but might as well be as animals, from the ways they treat others, as both are vicious.

Terrance was and is vicious enough for him to enter Laboratory 7, the House of Pain," the volunteers learned to call, as refer to it when someone goes there they never come out the same door.

Mrs. Haun was her title and name as far as I ever heard or knew. As the story goes, Terrance wanted to venture into town and see a jazz show. His mother said no, and because her son was so willful, she needed to lock him inside his bedroom for that night, lest he escape and do as he pleased. I did hear that Mrs. Haun referred to Terrance as her bullheaded son. He took that to heart and though his hatred, he took from Lab seven a vial of Reformation serum and tainted his mother's afternoon tea.

Reformation serum is as usually given in a large dose to a volunteer or subject, causing their bodies to become infected. Those so infected get other injections every other day until their changing begins skeletal transitions. Mrs. Haun never got that far, as she noted her infection, showing her changed self to her husband, and he then, injected her with the full term dose. He could have done for her what the good Professor Beaker does for me, but that Haun family ego got in the way.

It was a rumor around the research farm, that Doctor Haun was so spiteful of his test subjects, that when his wife became in partial ways like a Red Angus cow, he divorced her is an easy, non-legal fashion.

My having heard of what became from that kind and generous woman, got me later to thinking that one day I might just not go for my yearly injection and let science take its course.

You spoke of your loving me so know this, as our relationship can only go just to where we hold hands and kiss, we cannot have sex, as your entering me there would give you my infection. As well the good Professor does what he does for me as he feels apologetic, but would he do the same for you if infected, of that I do not know!"

"No sex, hmm..., to me that is part of a permanent relationship. However, and as much as your being furry and maybe someday change into the form of a Pronghorn deer, when that begins, then we shall enjoy our sexual selves, and I shall go with you!" I said, and at that point in our relationship, Debra smiled.
123221.title: Furry lover...

124.content:
Your name is Barry Barker. You are a technician for a software company, 25 years old and you live in Malibu. This is how it started.

It was Thursday afternoon and you let out a sigh. It looked like there was going to be another weekend. You then decide that since you weren’t doing anything tomorrow, you would spend today on a jog.

As you’re leaving you see that there was a new car in the driveway you didn’t recognize. The landlord did say that he was expecting a new tenant and he did tell you that she was somewhat unusual. Not that you’re going to bother with asking her out or anything. You never had any good luck with women. You haven’t had a date since high school and you worked at a company where there wasn’t a woman in sigh.

You let out a sigh and keep jogging down the street. “Another lonely weekend,” you say to yourself with a sigh. “Well, Barry, it’s official, you have the sex appeal of a coroner.”

You keep on jogging and you look back at a couple kissing on a bench. You let out a grunt. “Lucky guy,” you say. “That’s not going to be me anytime soon.” However, as you’re bemoaning your uneventful romance life, you bump into somebody and they let out a feminine grunt.

You hit the ground and gasp. “Oh,” you say. “And I very sorry. I… what the heck?!” You look up and see that you bumped into a woman. However, she wasn’t a human woman. She was an anthropomorphic….
124.title: Bump Into Hello

1241.content:
The woman you bumped into was a large hippopotamus woman. From the looks of it, she had bright green skin with long Shiny Midnight Black hair. She was 12’ tall and absolutely massive. Her breasts looked like E-cups and her stomach bulged out so big that her black shirt looked more like a bra. However, the biggest part of her body was her massive 7’ wide butt. The hippo woman was wearing a blue jacket and a pair of jeans and from the looks of it, her navel, lip and left eyebrow were pierced.

You look up in surprise and awe as your view is nearly obstructed by the belly of this big behemoth. “Oh,” says the hippo. “Oh my gosh! Are you alright.” You’re muttering and even have to wipe off your mouth because you can’t help but stare at her big curvy body. “Y-You, you’re a hippo! You’re a giant, talking hippo! H-How is that p-possi… p-possib…?” The hippo woman grabs your mouth to shut it and then gives a nervous laugh.

“I understand, I’m not exactly normal. In fact, I’m…” “B-Beautiful.” You say. The hippo woman just blushes at you and gives a smile. “Well, if you put it that way.” You stand up and look all around the big hippo lady. “You’re got quite a curvy body.” “What do you expect?” asks the strange woman. “I am a hippo.” “Uh, yeah,” you say nervously. “I take it you’re new in town.” “That’s me,” says the hippopotamus woman. “My name’s Salli. I just moved all the way here from Africa.” You nod your head. That sounded right. After all, Africa is the only place in the world you’ll find hippos. But where the hell in Africa would you find a humanoid one that could talk and walk upright.

“And you are?” asks Salli. You then shake your head and gulp. “I,” you say. “I’m Barry.” “Aha,” says Salli. “I heard about you. You live in the very same apartment building that I just moved in.” You couldn’t believe it. This hippo was your new neighbor. What are the chances?

“You know,” says the pachydermic beauty. “I’d like to know you better, Barry. How about we both get together…"
1241.title: Hippopotamus Goddess

My name’s Coral. I take it, you’re Barry Barker.”

You give a blush. “Yep. That’s me.” Coral then gives a smiles down at you, bending over to give you a good look at her breasts and her big udder. You stare in lust before Coral lifts you up off of the ground. “I thought so,” said Coral. “The landlord told me about you. You’re kinda cute.” You’re actually surprised. “How do you know my landlord.”

Coral gives a laugh. “Meet the new neighbor.” You couldn’t believe it. “Uh,” you say. “And why is my new neighbor a capricorn.” Coral lets out a sigh. “It’s a long story. You know, Barry. How would you like to…."

125221.content:
Your name is Gitonga, and you always wanted to live a normal life. Find a normal career, find a normal wife, settle down in a normal house and have normal children. But life never really turns out like you expect it. So when you did end up meeting Zakia, the only girl you’d want as your wife, she had one trait that was the opposite of ‘normal’; she was a hyena.

She grew up in Nairobi national park, where most of the anthros in your city are content to live out their lives, free from the discrimination and drudgery of civilized society. Zakia was a little more ambitious than that, though; fascinated by the human’s lifestyle, she aggressively pursued an education and moved downtown as soon as she could. Despite the fact that anthros weren’t even allowed to set foot in most businesses, with her dedication, she currently has a job as a personal trainer. It wasn’t much, but it let her break free from the kibera slums and move to syokimau, where the two of you first met. You’ll never forget those few days together. She certainly made an impression.

She’s a… big woman, to say the least. Apparently, it’s natural for female hyenas to be stronger than the males, and it showed. She naturally had the proportions of a bodybuilder; with thick, muscular arms and legs, wide, toned thighs, and perfectly sculpted abs which were visible even through her thick fur. She was even a few inches taller than you. At first, she didn’t really know her own strength; as indicated by the time you had to go to the hospital after she accidentally hugged you too tightly. Since that incident, she’s been exceedingly gentle with you, growing almost protective as the months drift by.

She was truly a one-of-a-kind sort of gal; incredibly strong, tough and independent, while also having a sensitive side. She was honest and reliable too, dedicated to a simple and happy relationship, without any mind games or passive-aggressiveness. Whenever the two of you had an argument, it was always calm and reasonable, and she always tried to see things from your point of view. Above all, she was just fun to be around, and somehow always coaxed you out of your shell and made you see life through a different lens. All these qualities made you fall in love with her, despite the fact that she was so… abnormal.

Of course, interspecies relationships were not exactly popular. You can always see people giving you and Zakia dirty or confused looks as you walked by. People seem to stereotype Zakia as an untamed beast, and you as some kind of pervert with a hyena fetish. Your parents approved least of all; your father about disowned you on the spot. You didn’t really have anybody in the way of friends. Truly, you and Zakia were alone together, shunned by society, with only eachother to confide in.

“You’re a sight for sore eyes, mpenzi,” she says, stumbling through the front door with a frown on her face. You worked from home as a graphic designer, leaving Zakia to go out and deal with workplace bullshit. Like a dopey puppy dog, you were always right there at the front door whenever she came home from work, eager to ease her frustrations.

“Bad day?” You ask from the kitchen as she stomps into the living room.

“You could say so,” she grumbled. “New manager said he was worried I might not ‘fit in’ in an office environment. Worried I might be a danger to my coworkers.” Immediately upon walking in, Zakia wasted no time taking off her uncomfortably workplace attire. Clothes combined with fur was just uncomfortable, you see, so most anthros chose to go nude if at all possible. The ‘wild’ anthros, and those in preserves, could waltz around naked as they please, but in the cities, anthros unfortunately had to wear clothes. Zakia liked to lounge around the apartment naked, at least.

You certainly weren’t complaining. You enjoyed seeing every curve of her thick, toned hips. In comparison, her breasts were downright small, but impressively perky. You were once a little confused and turned off by her muscular, furry body… but every day, you gradually find her more and more gorgeous and unique. She crashes on the couch with a groan. “A danger?” You ask. “Why would you be a danger?”

“Hell if I know. He said something about rabies…” She vents loudly. “Just because I’m a hyena, that asshole thinks I should be huntin’ antelopes on the serengeti or some shit. He probably wants to put a muzzle on me.”

“I think I know what might brighten your spirits…” You finally emerge from the kitchen, carrying something. She smiles when you lay a tray down on the table in front of her, offering freshly-prepared pilaf and beef stew with a glass of bhang.

She let's out that familiar, cute little laugh of surprise and gratitude. “Oh, you’re an angel,” she says, a big grin on her face. Your timing couldn’t have been better. You settle down on the couch by the nude hyena, cuddling and watching television while she chows down. Almost immediately, she forgets all about the troubles of the day as you chat and laugh together, melting into each other's arms. With her size and musculature, she always takes charge in any of your cuddling endeavours, sometimes holding you in her arms like an oversized teddy bear. Eventually, though, you noticed her starting to get restless. “You know, we should go somewhere. Like, really go somewhere. I’m tired of lounging around the apartment.”

“Alright, I’m down,” you nod. “Where do you want to go?”
125221.title: Zakia the Hyena
